title: Kunal Kamra Sparks Row With T-Shirt Mocking RSS, BJP Warns Of Action

title: Army Begins Unarmed Combat Drill  'AMAR' At Altitudes Exceeding 14,000 Feet

title: Imran Khan, Bushra Bibi, Asim Munir: The silent coup and Pak's new triumvirate
content: In a dramatic shift, Pakistan's 27th Constitutional Amendment has completely altered its governance landscape. This change provides lifetime immunity to President Zardari and Field Marshal Munir, while jeopardizing the independence of the judiciary. With the military chief now controlling all major services, including the nuclear arsenal, the Supreme Court has been reduced to a mere puppet of the executive branch.

title: 'No amount of denial ...': MEA calls out China over Arunachal claim; flags violations
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has strongly condemned China's detention of an Arunachal Pradesh woman in Shanghai, calling it a violation of international norms and Indian sovereignty. Beijing's refusal to accept her Indian passport, citing its claim over Arunachal Pradesh, has sparked outrage.

title: BrahMos gold rush: India close to inking deals worth $450m; how Op Sindoor played role
content: India is close to signing defense deals worth $450 million for BrahMos supersonic cruise missiles. These advanced weapons impressed friendly nations after their precise strikes during a recent conflict. The missiles are also being integrated into the Indian Navy and Air Force. This development highlights India's growing defense capabilities and interest from global buyers.

title: T20 World Cup: Suryakumar reveals team he wants to defeat in final, it's not PAK - Watch
content: Suryakumar Yadav expressed a desire to face Australia in the 2026 T20 World Cup final for redemption after the 2023 ODI World Cup loss. Rohit Sharma and Harmanpreet Kaur emphasized winning over opponent preference. Rohit was also announced as the tournament ambassador. India are in Group A along with Pakistan.

title: 'Full confidence in security': Israel after Netanyahu defers India visit; new dates soon
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu expressed full confidence in India's security under Prime Minister Narendra Modi, with both nations working to reschedule Netanyahu's postponed visit. The statement follows a car blast in Delhi, prompting Netanyahu to emphasize the shared spirit of both countries in confronting terrorism.

title: Amazon's AI power play: Tech giant vetoes third-party tools; 'Kiro' takes centre stage
content: Amazon has directed its software engineers to cease using third-party AI coding tools like OpenAI's Codex and Anthropic's Claude Code, mandating exclusive use of its proprietary system, Kiro. This strategic move aims to bolster Amazon's competitive standing against rivals OpenAI and Google in the rapidly expanding AI code assistant market.

title: Vande Bharat sleeper trains; AC-powered Amrit Bharat upgrades - What train travel will look like in 2026
content: Over 200 Vande Bharat sleeper trains are expected to be rolled out in the coming years as Indian Railways looks to revamp long-distance train travel. What trains can passengers look forward to in the coming years? What will be the features of these trains and rollout timelines? We explore:

title: ICC T20 WC: Tournament to begin on February 7, final on March 8 - Check full schedule
content: The ICC has unveiled the schedule for the 2026 T20 World Cup, co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka. The tournament kicks off on February 7th, featuring Pakistan vs. Netherlands and India's title defense against the USA. The event will span 29 days across eight venues, culminating in the final on March 8th.

title: Left in lurch: With Red fading in Bengal and Tripura, will Kerala's communists find their direction?
content: India's Left faces an introspective period marked by declining vote shares and ideological confusion, evident in West Bengal and Tripura. While Kerala remains a stronghold, it too faces challenges, prompting questions about the party's ability to adapt and reinvent itself amidst shifting political landscapes and strategic alliances.

title: 'Standing between America & recession': Nvidia CEO's fiery remark; warns of AI bubble
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated the company's performance is critical to the global economy, acting as a safeguard against recession. He highlighted the immense pressure Nvidia faces as the backbone of the AI boom, with its success viewed as crucial for both Silicon Valley and Wall Street.

title: 50 years after Tony Greig's 'Grovel', SA head coach repeats word
content: Conrad triggered controversy at the end of the fourth day‚Äôs play in Guwahati after using a phrase that carries a loaded history in cricket. Speaking at the press conference after  the day's play, Conrad said, "We wanted them (India) to really grovel." The Proteas kept on batting despite the lead crossing 500 in the second session and coach Shukri Conrad said they wanted to make sure they ended India's hopes of a series-levelling win.

title: 'Until Brahmin donates daughter': IAS officer's remark stirs row; issues clarification
content: A senior IAS officer in Madhya Pradesh faces backlash after a viral video showed him linking reservation continuation to inter-caste marriage. The All India Brahmin Society condemned the remarks as "indecent" and "casteist," demanding an FIR and disciplinary action. The officer later clarified his statement was taken out of context, expressing regret if sentiments were hurt.

title: 'Don't recognise Arunachal': China on Indian harassed in Shanghai; Cong urges govt to reply
content: China denied harassing an Indian woman at Shanghai airport, stating border checks were lawful. The woman's passport was flagged due to Arunachal Pradesh being listed as her birthplace. India lodged a strong protest, asserting Arunachal Pradesh's status as an integral part of India.

title: Gemini 3.0 launch: Salesforce CEO says won't use ChatGPT again; praises Google‚Äôs AI model
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff declared he's switching from ChatGPT to Google's Gemini 3.0 after a two-hour trial, citing significant improvements in reasoning, speed, image, and video processing. This endorsement highlights the intense competition in the AI landscape, with even OpenAI's CEO acknowledging Google's advancements.

title: Did Jordon Hudson catch Pablo Torre lying? Belichick‚Äôs girlfriend drops receipts
content: Jordon Hudson escalates her feud with Pablo Torre after accusing him of publishing ‚Äúinaccurate and materially defamatory‚Äù reports about her relationship with Bill Belichick. Hudson posts screenshots she says prove her case, while Torre publicly questions whether the images were altered. The controversy continues to overshadow Bill Belichick‚Äôs rocky first season at North Carolina.

title: Happy Thanksgiving 2025: Best messages, greetings, wishes and images
content: Thanksgiving, a tradition evolving from harvest celebrations to national togetherness, emphasizes good food and company. Beyond the feasting, the core remains people gathering, whether through cherished family recipes or Friendsgiving gatherings. This festive season encourages gratitude, urging a focus on thankfulness rather than minor annoyances. The article offers heartfelt messages to share, celebrating connection and appreciation.

title: 'Delete Central govt': Mamata sets condition to back SIR; attacks EC, BJP over survey
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee expressed affection for Bangladesh due to shared language and criticized the BJP-led central government and Election Commission over the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls. She warned against rushing the process before the 2026 polls and accused the EC of losing impartiality, calling it a 'BJP Commission'.

title: Will Trey Benson play Week 13? Cardinals eye return of explosive rookie
content: Injuries have plagued the Cardinals' backfield, with Trey Benson's season-ending injury after James Conner's sidelining disrupting their plans. Benson's return to practice offers a chance to re-evaluate the rushing attack and his potential as a foundational piece for the team's future.

title: Is Erika Kirk pregnant? Megyn Kelly reacts to her prayer after Charlie‚Äôs death
content: Erika Kirk, widow of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, revealed her profound grief and hope during a talk with Megyn Kelly. She shared her prayer of being pregnant at the time of Charlie's tragic death, desiring a larger family. Erika also urged young women to prioritize starting families, emphasizing that careers can wait, but motherhood cannot be indefinitely postponed.

title: T20 World Cup: Ind‚ÄìPak match set for February 15; check men in blue's full schedule
content: The ICC has unveiled the 2026 T20 World Cup schedule, co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka. Defending champions India begin their campaign against the USA in Mumbai on February 7. The highly anticipated India-Pakistan clash is slated for February 15 in Colombo. The tournament features 20 teams across eight venues, with knockout stage venues dependent on Pakistan's progression.

title: 'Secret deal': DKS refuses to speak on K'taka CM row; what Kharge said
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar described the CM change issue as a "secret deal" among a few party leaders, stating he wouldn't discuss it publicly to avoid embarrassing the organization. He emphasized the importance of party unity and conscience. Meanwhile, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge also stressed that leadership changes are not for public discussion.

title: 28 Naxalites quit arms: Group with Rs 89 lakh bounty surrenders in Chhattisgarh
content: Twenty-eight Naxalites, including 19 women and 22 cadres with rewards totaling Rs 89 lakh, surrendered in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur district. Driven by development initiatives and rehabilitation policies, the surrender reflects a shift away from Maoist ideology. This follows over 512 cadres joining the mainstream in Bastar over the last 50 days.

title: Bruins‚Äô Charlie McAvoy hit by heartbreaking week as wife Kiley shares update
content: Boston Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy is going through a devastating week. As his wife Kiley McAvoy revealed an emotional family update on social media. With Charlie already recovering from recent jaw surgery. The couple is now facing additional personal challenges involving their young son.

title: 'Zubeen Garg murdered': Assam CM makes big claim; hints at shocking motive
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma declared singer Zubeen Garg's death in Singapore a "plain and simple murder" in the state Assembly. He stated one person was responsible, with others aiding them. The opposition's adjournment motion to discuss the circumstances was admitted, with a Special Investigation Team and a judicial commission probing the incident.

title: Explained: ISI Bill 2025 and what it means for Kolkata‚Äôs control over its own institution
content: The draft Indian Statistical Institute Bill, 2025 proposes a major structural shift for ISI by replacing its society-based governance with a centrally defined statutory framework. For ISI Kolkata, this means a reorganisation of authority, decision-making and institutional hierarchy as the new Board of Governance becomes the primary decision-maker across academics, administration, finances and the future shape of ISI‚Äôs centres.

title: Heart health: How irregular sleep affect heart? What mechanisms trigger cardiac events?
content: Prioritizing quality sleep is crucial for a healthy heart, according to Dr. Irfan Khan.  Poor sleep, often due to modern lifestyle, disrupts vital bodily functions like blood pressure regulation and hormone balance.  This can significantly increase the risk of hypertension, heart disease, and other serious cardiovascular issues, even worsening existing conditions.

title: 'No good and bad Taliban': Pak refutes attacking Afghanistan; Kabul vows retaliation
content: Pakistan's military on Tuesday vehemently denied Afghan Taliban claims of conducting overnight airstrikes within Afghanistan, which reportedly killed ten people.  The Afghan government condemned the alleged "hostile actions" as a violation of sovereignty and vowed a response. Pakistan's army spokesperson dismissed the accusations as "baseless," highlighting a growing border dispute.

title: Explained: Why Bitcoin is sliding ‚Äî and why the pain may not be over
content: Bitcoin's recent steep fall, marked by a $1 trillion market wipeout, is attributed to five key factors identified by Deutsche Bank. These include a broader risk-off sentiment mirroring tech stocks, hawkish Fed signals, stalled regulatory clarity, institutional pullback after liquidations, and long-term holders cashing in, creating a liquidity shock.

title: 'China running racket': EU attacks Beijing; rare earth curbs cause rift
content: The EU has strongly criticized China's control over rare earth exports, with a top official labeling Beijing's restrictions a "racket" that jeopardizes Europe's strategic autonomy.  The bloc is urged to accelerate efforts to reduce its dependence on Chinese critical minerals by diversifying supply chains and strengthening domestic capacity.

title: South Africa eye clean sweep as India stare at a mountain they can not climb
content: India faces an uphill battle in the final Test, needing an improbable 522 runs after losing two early wickets. South Africa declared at 260/5, setting a daunting target. With a series sweep looming, the Proteas aim to take eight wickets on the final day, while India must survive an almost impossible chase.

title: 3 night time drinks that can help reduce High Blood Pressure in the morning
content: The minerals, calcium, potassium and magnesium present in milk help blood vessels relax, while maintaining proper fluid equilibrium. The cardiovascular system experiences reduced pressure because of these effects, which also enhance artery flexibility

title: Madeline Mann spills the beans on mastering the interview question most candidates get wrong
content: Madeline Mann, founder of Self Made Millennial, explains why the seemingly simple ‚ÄúTell me about yourself‚Äù question often determines the course of an interview. She breaks down a precise three-step method‚Äîaligning your background with the job, highlighting measurable achievements, and ending with a clear ‚Äúwhy‚Äù‚Äîto help candidates deliver sharper, more purposeful introductions and avoid common pitfalls.

title: Don‚Äôt look at top stocks to buy! Should you invest in stocks directly at all?
content: Direct stock investing demands significant time, temperament, and skill, often exceeding what most salaried individuals can commit. Full-time fund managers possess these advantages. For most, a diversified mutual fund portfolio offers a more realistic path to wealth creation, avoiding common investor pitfalls like panic selling and excessive trading. Direct stocks can be explored as a small, experimental allocation.

title: Wig, makeup & horror: Man impersonates dead mother for pension
content: A shocking case has emerged in Italy where a former nurse allegedly mummified his mother's body to impersonate her for three years, claiming her pension and controlling her properties. The elaborate fraud unraveled during a routine identity card renewal at the registry office, leading to the discovery of the mummified remains and serious charges against the man.

title: 'Misfit for Army': SC flays Christian soldier's indiscipline; refused command to enter temple
content: The Supreme Court has upheld the dismissal of a Christian Army soldier for refusing to enter a gurdwara during a regimental activity, deeming his actions "gross indiscipline." Justices labelled him an "absolute misfit," emphasizing the paramount importance of discipline in the Army. The soldier's appeal was rejected, confirming his termination for placing personal beliefs above lawful commands.

title: B'luru horror: Man injects wife with mercury; dowry angle being probed
content: A Karnataka homemaker has accused her husband of injecting her with mercury nine months prior to her death, leading to a slow decline in her health.  Before passing away, she provided a pre-death statement to police detailing the alleged assault and subsequent suffering. The case is now being investigated as a potential dowry-related death.

title: A guide for women to freeze eggs properly, risks, outcomes and expectations
content: Egg freezing offers women extended reproductive choice, but it's not a guarantee of future pregnancy. Success hinges on age and the number of mature eggs retrieved, with younger women and those aiming for around fifteen eggs seeing better outcomes. Understanding the process's limitations and costs is crucial for informed decision-making.

title: 'Shouldn't coach be sacked': Raina defends Gambhir, reveals Team India's 'problem'
content: Suresh Raina defended head coach Gautam Gambhir amidst India's Test struggles, emphasizing player accountability. He highlighted Gambhir's success in white-ball formats and stressed that coaches guide, while players must perform. Raina also advocated for domestic performance to influence selection, anticipating a stronger ODI squad with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's return for the South Africa series.

title: Wayne Gretzky faces backlash as ‚ÄòTrump‚Äôs Canadian mascot‚Äô label spreads
content: Canada's hockey icon Wayne Gretzky faced boos at a recent event, sparking debate about his association with American politics.  Gretzky, asserting his Canadian identity, stated he's "Canadian for life."  His response highlights the complex relationship between national heroes, personal choices, and public expectations, revealing much about Canadian pride and how deeply they connect with their sports symbols.

title: ‚ÄòBuying veggies felt like a full academic module‚Äô: Indian student on life abroad
content: Neeharika's study abroad journey from Bengaluru to the UK reveals a profound personal transformation. She navigated initial quietude and daily challenges, learning independence through everyday tasks. University life demanded self-direction, while building a community provided crucial support. This experience underscores that growth abroad is subtle, unfolding through ordinary moments and quiet victories, ultimately proving immensely rewarding.

title: 'King in his kingdom': Kohli arrives in India ahead of ODI series against SA - Watch
content: Virat Kohli has arrived in India for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa. The series begins on November 30. KL Rahul will captain the team. Ravindra Jadeja returns to the squad. Axar Patel has been excluded. The matches will be held in Ranchi, Raipur, and Visakhapatnam. Kohli last played in the ODI series against Australia in October. ‚Äã‚Äã

title: Silent for 10,000 years‚Ä¶ then a blast: Eyewitnesses recall Ethiopia volcano eruption ‚Äî watch
content: A remote Ethiopian volcano, dormant for millennia, erupted violently, spewing ash 15km high and darkening skies.  Locals described the blast as a "bomb of smoke and ash." While no lives were lost, the eruption has severely impacted livestock-herding communities, with ash covering grazing lands and threatening livelihoods.  The event has caused widespread shock due to its unprecedented nature.

title: 'Centuries-old pain put to rest': PM Modi at 'Dhwaj Arohan' ceremony; key takeaways
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi ceremonially hoisted a saffron Dharma Dhwaj atop the Ram temple in Ayodhya, marking its formal construction completion. He stated that the 'pain of centuries finds rest today' and the resolve of centuries is attaining fulfillment. The flag symbolizes the renaissance of Indian civilisation and the ideals of Ram Rajya.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal jumps sharply; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold prices surged on Tuesday, driven by increasing expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut in December following dovish comments from officials. This optimism pushed bullion higher for the third consecutive session, with traders increasing bets on easier monetary policy. City-wise prices also saw an uptick across major Indian cities.

content: arman Tsarukyan is one of the best lightweights in the world on saturday . he choked out Dan Hooker in a one-sided main event of UFC Fight Night in doha, Qatar . the only other movement in these rankings is at welterweight .

title: Operation Sindoor: 19 CISF personnel honoured; receive coveted 'DG's disk'
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‚Äòprime‚Äô political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India‚Äôs neighbourhood. Read More

title: 49ers top Panthers, as Christian McCaffrey beats former team
content: the 49ers beat the Carolina Panthers 20-9 in a game that figures to be pivotal in the NFC playoff chase . it happened again Monday night as the Niners overcame a litany of first-half mistakes to knock off a 49ers 20-9 . quarterback j'ayir brown provided the biggest slams for the Panthers .
